rules: Rule1: If the failure is logged, then it is documented.
Rule2: Provided that the researcher consumes a snack, the researcher becomes distracted.
Rule3: Either the researcher consumes a snack, or if the prototype uses alloy, the material is lightweight.
Rule4: Whenever the engineer works overtime, then if it is not the case that consuming a snack leads to the researcher not being distracted, the analysis is delayed.
Rule5: The engineer works overtime, or the technician works overtime.

Rule6: Provided that the manager notifies the engineer, then if the technician works overtime, the situation where consuming a snack does not result in the researcher being undistracted leads to the analysis being delayed.

Rule7: If the manager notifies the technician, then when the technician works overtime, the circumstance that consuming a snack does not entail the researcher being undistracted results in the analysis being delayed.
Rule8: Should the laptop have a screen issue, then the smartphone does not have a battery issue.
Rule9: Given that the engineer receives a notification, the manager notifies the engineer.
Rule10: Whenever the technician receives a notification, the manager notifies the technician.
Rule11: If the deadline is urgent, then either the engineer receives a notification or the technician receives a notification.
Rule12: Assuming the laptop is repaired, the laptop has a screen issue.
Rule13: In the case that the smartphone is repaired, the laptop is repaired.
Rule14: Either the task is completed, or if it is not the case that assigning a task by the manager implies that a lack of funding leads to the smartphone being repaired, then the task is delegated.
Rule15: If the report is reviewed, then either the safety check passes or the project is funded.
Rule16: The report is submitted, or the report is reviewed.
Rule17: Whenever the technician tests the smartphone, then if the project is not funded, the laptop has a screen issue.
Rule18: Either the technician tests the smartphone, or the technician tests the laptop.
Rule19: Under the condition that the prototype uses alloy, the material is not lightweight.
Rule20: Either the prototype uses alloy, or the prototype is not approved.
Rule21: The prototype uses plastic, or the prototype does not use alloy.
Rule22: Should it not be the case that the technician testing the laptop entails that a lack of funding results in the laptop having a screen issue, the prototype is approved.
Rule23: Under the condition that it is not true that the technician performing the safety check leads to either the safety check passing or the project being funded, the failure is logged.
Rule24: If it is not the case that the technician performing the safety check results in either the safety check passing or the project being funded, then the failure is not documented.
Rule25: Whenever the project is not funded, the smartphone has a battery issue.
facts: Fact2: The manager assigns a task.
Fact3: The technician performs the safety check.
Fact4: The analysis is not delayed.
Fact5: The task is not delegated.
Fact6: The task is not completed.
Fact7: The report is not submitted.
Fact8: The prototype does not use plastic.
Fact9: The safety check does not pass.
